intro: Alopecurus diandrus, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, temperate environments such as meadows and wetlands. The plant features slender stems and small, grass-like leaves, with spikes of tiny, greenish-white flowers appearing in late summer. Its root system is fibrous, allowing it to thrive in nutrient-rich soils. Alopecurus diandrus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
